info.title: Tradeverifyd
info.description:
The Tradeverifyd API offers advanced capabilities for analyzing supply chain entities and their intricate relationships, enabling users to gain deep insights into the complex dynamics of global trade networks.

For more information visit [tradeverifyd.com](https://tradeverifyd.com).

If you have questions regarding specific use cases or how to accomplish them, please reach out to [support@tradeverifyd.com](mailto:support@tradeverifyd.com?subject=Tradeverifyd%20use%20cases) for guidance.

When making requests that require a Tradeverifyd API Key make sure the correct HTTP Header is included.

For example:

```bash
curl --silent --location -G 'https://.../v1/search/entities' \
--data-urlencode 'name=Contoso Corporation' \
--data-urlencode 'jurisdiction=US' \
--header "ocp-apim-subscription-key: $TRADEVERIFYD_API_KEY"
```

get.description:
Get entities that have flags of a specific flag type.

This endpoint allows customers to query entities based on specific compliance flags.
Results are paginated and filtered by organization access control.

Only entities with flags that are either public or belong to the user's organization
will be returned.

Args:
    flag_type_id: ObjectId of the flag type from flag_types collection
    page: Page number (1-based) for pagination
    limit: Maximum number of entities to return per page

Returns:
    Paginated list of entities with the specified flag type, including:
    - Entity details (name, jurisdiction, type, status)
    - TV scores
    - Flag information
    - Pagination metadata

get.description:
Retrieve a graph of relationships for a single Entity.

This endpoint provides information about the relationships of an Entity,
such as partnerships, affiliations, or any other defined connections. The
returned graph contains entity relationship data and includes
entity properties.

Note: This endpoint does not include Flags or Risk Events data. Use the
separate /flags and /risk_events endpoints to retrieve that information
for specific entities.

If you do not provide both page and page_size, the graph will be returned in a single response.

parameters.name: entity_id

schema.description: Id of the Entity to use as the starting or root entity for graph retrieval.
schema.title: Entity Id

parameters.description: Id of the Entity to use as the starting or root entity for graph retrieval.

parameters.name: hs_codes

schema.description: A comma separred list of 2, 4, or 6-digit HS codes to filter by. A less-specific HS code will always match a more-specific code with the same chapter or heading. For example, code '12' will match '1234' and '1256'. If list is empty or null, all relationships are returned.
schema.title: Hs Codes

parameters.description: A comma separred list of 2, 4, or 6-digit HS codes to filter by. A less-specific HS code will always match a more-specific code with the same chapter or heading. For example, code '12' will match '1234' and '1256'. If list is empty or null, all relationships are returned.

parameters.name: depth

schema.description: Limits how many levels of related relationships the query will explore. For example, a depth of 1 returns only directly related items, while higher values include more distant connections.For larger depths, please note that page and page_size will be defaulted,if not explicitly passed set.
schema.title: Depth

parameters.description: Limits how many levels of related relationships the query will explore. For example, a depth of 1 returns only directly related items, while higher values include more distant connections.For larger depths, please note that page and page_size will be defaulted,if not explicitly passed set.

get.description:
Retrieve a graph of relationships for a single Entity.

This endpoint provides information about the relationships of an Entity,
such as partnerships, affiliations, or any other defined connections. The
connected Entities in the returned graph include added context for each
Entity, such as active Flags and Risk Events.

parameters.name: entity_id

schema.description: Id of the Entity to use as the starting node for graph retrieval.
schema.title: Entity Id

parameters.description: Id of the Entity to use as the starting node for graph retrieval.

parameters.name: hs_codes

schema.description: Filter by 2, 4, or 6-digit Harmonized System (HS) codes. In direct API calls to send multiple hs_codes repeat the parameter: ?hs_codes=12&hs_codes=34&hs_codes=5678. A less-specific HS code will match more-specific codes with the same prefix. (e.g., '12' matches '1234' and '1256'). When provided, relationships involving ANY of these product codes are included. If omitted, all relationships are returned.Use with 'filter_strategy' to control how filtering is applied in the graph.
schema.title: Hs Codes

parameters.description: Filter by 2, 4, or 6-digit Harmonized System (HS) codes. In direct API calls to send multiple hs_codes repeat the parameter: ?hs_codes=12&hs_codes=34&hs_codes=5678. A less-specific HS code will match more-specific codes with the same prefix. (e.g., '12' matches '1234' and '1256'). When provided, relationships involving ANY of these product codes are included. If omitted, all relationships are returned.Use with 'filter_strategy' to control how filtering is applied in the graph.

parameters.name: depth

schema.description: Limits how many levels of related relationships the query will explore. For example, a depth of 1 returns only directly related items, while higher values include more distant connections.
schema.title: Depth

parameters.description: Limits how many levels of related relationships the query will explore. For example, a depth of 1 returns only directly related items, while higher values include more distant connections.

parameters.name: include_outgoing

schema.description: When 'false', only incoming relationships for the Entity specified by the user-supplied Entity Id is returned.
schema.title: Include Outgoing

parameters.description: When 'false', only incoming relationships for the Entity specified by the user-supplied Entity Id is returned.

parameters.name: filter_strategy

schema.description: If 'hs_codes' are provided and 'filter_strategy' is 'strict', only relationships that match at least 1 of the provided codes will be followed while assembling the graph outward from the entrypoint Entity. If 'filter_strategy' is 'lax', every edge on any path between a matched HS code and the entrypoint is included, as well as every edge that lies beyond a matched HS code while traversing either upstream or downstream from the entrypoint. If no HS codes are provided, this parameter has no effect.
schema.title: Filter Strategy

parameters.description: If 'hs_codes' are provided and 'filter_strategy' is 'strict', only relationships that match at least 1 of the provided codes will be followed while assembling the graph outward from the entrypoint Entity. If 'filter_strategy' is 'lax', every edge on any path between a matched HS code and the entrypoint is included, as well as every edge that lies beyond a matched HS code while traversing either upstream or downstream from the entrypoint. If no HS codes are provided, this parameter has no effect.

parameters.name: preserve_corporate_relationships

schema.description: If 'hs_codes' are set, this parameter will include certain relationship types that describe corporate structures regardless of the HS codes they contain (for example, parent-subsidiary relationships). This is most useful in the context of 'strict' HS code filtering to follow the flow of a particular set of goods without losing information about the corporate structure of Entities involved in the graph.
schema.title: Preserve Corporate Relationships

parameters.description: If 'hs_codes' are set, this parameter will include certain relationship types that describe corporate structures regardless of the HS codes they contain (for example, parent-subsidiary relationships). This is most useful in the context of 'strict' HS code filtering to follow the flow of a particular set of goods without losing information about the corporate structure of Entities involved in the graph.

parameters.name: global_root_id

schema.description:
Note: to use this paramter, 'include_outgoing' must be 'false'.

If provided, the Entity with id matching 'global_root_id' will be set as the 'root' of the returned graph, and all outgoing relationships from the entrypoint Entity (set by parameter 'entity_id') to the Entity specified by 'global_root_id' will be included in the response. Filter parameters are still honored for relationships upstream of the entrypoint Entity.
schema.title: Global Root Id

parameters.description:
Note: to use this paramter, 'include_outgoing' must be 'false'.

If provided, the Entity with id matching 'global_root_id' will be set as the 'root' of the returned graph, and all outgoing relationships from the entrypoint Entity (set by parameter 'entity_id') to the Entity specified by 'global_root_id' will be included in the response. Filter parameters are still honored for relationships upstream of the entrypoint Entity.

parameters.name: include_counts

schema.description: If true, an entity counts graph counts section is include in the result setNOTE: using this option will significanly increase response times on large graphs.When retrieving graphs with over 1000 nodes, the counts are not returned.
schema.title: Include Counts

parameters.description: If true, an entity counts graph counts section is include in the result setNOTE: using this option will significanly increase response times on large graphs.When retrieving graphs with over 1000 nodes, the counts are not returned.

parameters.name: only_supplier_relationships

schema.description: When true, this builds a graph using an alternative mechanismThis will increase performance, however it maybe not be an exact 1 to 1 match with the previous graph in all scenariosThis graph will ignore the include_outgoing flag.Only incoming relationships are included.
schema.title: Only Supplier Relationships

parameters.description: When true, this builds a graph using an alternative mechanismThis will increase performance, however it maybe not be an exact 1 to 1 match with the previous graph in all scenariosThis graph will ignore the include_outgoing flag.Only incoming relationships are included.

    HTTPException: 404 if report not found, 403 if report not approved, 400 for invalid supplement requests.

post.description:
Upload flags for processing. Expected time to process and be available in the
system is approximately 5-10 minutes.

This endpoint allows uploading flags for entities. Each flag must be associated with an entity
and contain information about potential risks or issues.

**Entity Identification Requirements:**
- Either provide `entity_id` (preferred) OR both `entity_name` and `entity_jurisdiction`
- If using name/jurisdiction, both fields are required to uniquely identify the entity

**Required Fields:**
- `flag_type`: The primary category of the flag (e.g., "Sanctions & Restricted Entities Risk",
"Worker & Consumer Safety Risk", "Environmental Violations Risk")
- `flag_subtype`: A more specific classification within the flag type (e.g.,
"Financial Crimes & Violations", "International Sanctions", "Terrorism Financing")
- `source_location`: The URL or location where the flag information was found
(e.g., "https://example.example/news/article")
- `description`: Detailed explanation of the flag and its significance

Note: `flag_type` and `flag_subtype` must fall into one of the existing flag types defined in the system.

**Optional Fields:**
- `tags`: Single word identifier for categorizing flags by subcategories
- `time_start`: Start date/time when the flag becomes valid
- `time_end`: End date/time when the flag expires

**Response:**
Returns a summary of the processing results including the total number of flags submitted
and how many were successfully inserted into the system.

ofac_sanctions_flag.description: Flag indicating entity appears on OFAC sanctions list. Uses entity_id for identification.

value.description: Entity appears on OFAC Specially Designated Nationals List for involvement in illicit activities

adverse_media_flag.description: Flag for negative media coverage. Uses entity name and jurisdiction for identification.

value.description: Media reports indicate potential labor rights violations at manufacturing facilities

value.description: Operating without required environmental compliance certifications

Reports of accounting irregularities and potential fraud

put.description:
Update an existing Flag.

Users can only update Flags that belong to their organization.

The provided information will override existing information. It is not a merge.

### Args:
- FlagUpdateItem: JSON object specifying Flag information for update.

### Returns:
- FlagDTO: The Flag object representing the updated flag.

### Example Usage:
- Requesting `PUT /update_flag` with a valid flag_id that belongs to the user's organization
    will update the specified flag.

get.description:
Retrieve flags related to a specific entity, with options for recursive
retrieval and depth control.

This endpoint is designed to provide a list of flags associated with an
entity. Flags represent important markers or alerts related to the entity,
such as compliance issues, risk indicators, or other significant
annotations. The endpoint supports recursive retrieval of flags and allows
specifying the depth of retrieval, enabling a comprehensive view of related
flags.

Flags can be invalidated by external evidence, or no longer apply for time
reasons to a specific entity.

## Note:
- Either `entity_id` or both `entity_name` and `entity_jurisdiction` must
  be provided to retrieve flags for a specific entity.
- `depth` has no effect if recursive retrieval is not enabled.

parameters.name: entity_id

schema.description: The unique identifier of the entity for which flags are being requested. This parameter is required if 'entity_name' and 'entity_jurisdiction' are not provided.

parameters.name: entity_jurisdiction

schema.title: Entity Jurisdiction

parameters.description: The jurisdiction of the entity for which flags are being requested. Should only be set in conjunction with 'entity_name'.

parameters.name: recursive

schema.title: Recursive

post.description: Creates a new shipment. **REST API Best Practice**: This endpoint should be used for creating new shipments only. For updating existing shipments, a PUT /shipments/{shipment_id} endpoint should be used instead. Currently, this endpoint supports both operations for backward compatibility: if shipment_id is provided, the shipment will be updated; if no shipment_id is provided, a new shipment will be created. All organizational units specified in the request must be accessible to the user. The API supports multiple organizational units per shipment to enable flexible organization structure management. Auto-creates LEI and ITI credentials if organization has AUTO_CREATE_SHIPMENT_CREDENTIALS enabled.

BaseRiskEvent.title: BaseRiskEvent
BaseRiskEvent.description:
Represents an Event which happens in the real world that is likely to
disrupt economic activity for affected entities.

Attributes:
    id: Database id of the record, corresponds to MongoDB '_id'.

    title: The title or a brief description of the event. This should
    capture the essence of what the event is about.

    summary: A more detailed summary or description of the event. This
    provides additional context and information about the event.

    sources: References that report and/or describe the event.

    expires: Time after which the RiskEvent is no longer 'in-effect'.

    type: Identifies the type of the event. The event type is the main
    driver of event processing, e.g. when it expires, how it propagates to
    entities, etc.

    start_date: Time the event began

    end_date: Time the event ended

    last_propagation: Last time this event propagated to entities. Will be
    'None' if it has never been propagated.

    last_notification: Last time notifications for this event were
    published. Will be 'None' if no notifications have been generated.

    hidden: A 'hidden' RiskEvent has been un-propagated from all Entities so
    that it is no longer affecting any scores, and should not be displayed
    to any users. This field is temporary and will be displaced by
    'review_status' once accompanying features for 'review_status' are
    complete.

    review_status: New RiskEvents are created in a 'pending' state. Pending
    RiskEvents are invisible to end users, and have no impact on Entity
    scores or other calculations. On human review, a RiskEvent may be
    either 'approved' or 'denied'. If the RiskEvent is approved, it is
    propagated to affected Entities, where it will impact Entity risk
    scoring and other calculations. If denied, a corresponding
    'RiskEventFeedback' record exists that explains why the RiskEvent is
    irrelevant or inappropriate. RiskEvents are allowed to transition
    between 'approved' and 'denied' any number of times, though such
    transitions should be rare.

    extraction_metadata: LLM vendor, model, and schema used to extract Risk
    Event information from input text. This information can be used to
    compare the performance of different prompts and models.

    force_expired: If True, the expiration time set at creation has been
    manually overridden to 'force' the record to expire.

    original_expiry: If exists and is non-null, contains the expiration time
    from before the document was force-expired.

Entity.title: Entity
Entity.description:
Information about a business entity queried via pymongo

Datetime fields are parsed using dateutil.parser.parse
(https://dateutil.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parser.html) Temporal resolution
of input data varies, so resulting datetime objects may have 'time' fields
zeroed-out. For example, dateutil.parser.parse("2023-1-1") returns
datetime.datetime(2023,1,1,0,0). Resulting datetime will be naive unless
input string specifies an offset ("+=") or is explicitly in universal time
("Z", "UTC")

This model removes any sensitive information from records it is used to parse.
To override this behavior, pass 1 or more 'organization' values to validation context.

Example:

raw_entity_dict = {
...
}

# Sensitive info removed
Entity(**raw_entity_dict)

# Sensitive info also removed
Entity.model_validate(raw_entity_dict)

# Information private to org 'purina' is available on the resulting object
Entity.model_validate(raw_entity_dict, context={"organization": "purina"})

Attributes:
    id: Database id of the record, corresponds to mongodb '_id'.

    schema_version: Document schema.

    ids: array of Identifier class objects describing external identifiers for an entity.
    May be None if no identifiers are available for an entity. Current possible values are:
    ['BIC','CIN','LEI', 'opencorporates','registration','stock','tax','trademo']. BIC and LEI
    values come from GLEIF, opencorporates comes from OpenCorporates, trademo comes from
    Trademo, and CIN (company identification number), registration, stock, and tax come from
    manual entity research.

    name: a string represting the name of the entity

    status: string indicating the current status of an entity, e.g.
    "ACTIVE", "INACTIVE", etc. This field is not well-defined as definitions
    vary between sources (i.e. GLEIF vs OpenCorporates, etc.)

    jurisdiction: ISO country code of the entity if the jurisdiction is
    known

    created_at: Time record was created in database.

    modified: Last time record was modified.

    type: string representing what kind of entity the document represents,
    e.g.  "GENERAL", "Facility", etc. This field is not well-defined as
    definitions vary between sources (i.e. GLEIF vs OpenCorporates, etc.).

    url: an array of web addresses as strings that are associated with the
    entity, namely the company's main website or main source of information
    online.

    cyber: an instance of the Cyber class. This includes keys date, updated,
    expires, managing LOU, and corroboration.

    location: a dictionary of the Location class containing information on
    LegalAddress, HeadquartersAddress, and facilities.

    entity_creation_date: a datetime object in UTC timezone representing the
    date the legal entity was formed.

    registration: a instance of the Registration class containing
    information on when the entity was registered.

    metaData: an instance of the MetaData class.

    deleted: Whether or not the flag is currently in-force.

    deleted_at: If the flag is no longer in force for any reason, this field
    is the time the flag ceased to be applicable to the target entity.

    mesur_type: Distinguishes a business entity from a processing,
    manufacturing, or other type of facility operated by a business entity.

    priorData: Revision objects representing previous record states. Each
    subdocument includes the date changes were applied, and a set of
    key-value pairs, where each key corresponds to a field name, and each
    value is the field value prior to the change.

    tags: This field is unused/placeholder for future functionality. List of
    tags associated with entity. Can be arbitrary values, possibly generated
    by a LLM.

    geo_location: This field is unused/placeholder for future functionality.
    GeoJSON Point to serve as canonical geo location for entity.

    flags: All undeleted Flag documents associated with this entity. This
    field is populated by an asynchronous aggregation job, and may be stale.
    For the freshest possible data, repopulate this field with a '$lookup'
    stage from 'tradeverifyd.flags' at query time. By default, this Pydantic
    model removes all non-public flags from entity data it parses. See above
    for examples.

    normalized_products: All HS codes associated with this entity, grouped
    by the organization the shipping information belongs to. DO NOT use the
    contents of this field to infer the existence or absence of
    relationships for the entity, relations without HS codes will be missing
    from this field. This field is populated by an asynchronous aggregation
    job, and may be stale. For the freshest possible data, re-query relvant
    relationships with a '$lookup' stage from
    'tradeverifyd.entity_relationships' at query time. By default, this
    Pydantic model removes all non-public relation info from the entity data
    it parses. See above for examples.

    has_incoming_for: List of 'organization' tokens for which entity should
    be presented as having incoming relationship. This field is populated by
    an asynchronous aggregation job, and may be stale.  For the freshest
    possible data, repopulate this field with a '$lookup' stage from
    'tradeverifyd.entity_relationships' at query time. By default, this
    Pydantic model removes all organizations other than 'PUBLIC' from this
    field.

    has_outgoing_for: List of 'organization' tokens for which entity should
    be presented as having outgoing relationships. This field is populated
    by an asynchronous aggregation job, and may be stale.  For the freshest
    possible data, repopulate this field with a '$lookup' stage from
    'tradeverifyd.entity_relationships' at query time. By default, this
    Pydantic model removes all organizations other than 'PUBLIC' from this
    field.

    last_aggregated: Timestamp matching start time of last time flag and
    relationship related fields were aggregated onto this entity. All
    records from the same aggregation run will have identical
    'last_aggregated' time.

    addresses: Address information associated with the entity. This field
    has been added to accomodate data needs in Earthstream API and will be
    unpopulated for entities not uploaded through that platform. Eventually,
    all existing address data will likely be migrated to this field.

    subscribers: References to all 'Subscription' objects in which the
    Entity participates. This field is created dynamically when a new
    'Subscription' gets created, most 'Entity' records will not have it.

    risk_events: References to all Risk Events currently affecting the
    entity. This field is created dynamically when a new 'RiskEvent'
    propagates to the 'Entity', most records will not have it. The RiskEvent
    records embedded in this field allow extra attributes, the shape
    described here is the *minimum* data contract for an entry in
    Entity.risk_events.

    uuid: Optional uuid field for indentifying an Entity.

    region: a code such as US-WA indicating a region of the jurisdiction
    aligning with ISO 3166-2

    affiliated_jurisdiction - Some Entity records have been assigned a
    jurisdiction of UN, which is not a country, but indicates a world-wide
    UN organization. We have set affiliated_jurisdiction to be UN, and set
    jurisdiction from the entity's operating addresses

    data_score: a quick score which indicates relative completeness for some
    important fields in the entity record


    opencorporates_additional - Additional data specific to opencorporates
        home_jurisdiction_code: Jurisdiction code of the home company, in cases where the entity is a branch
        home_jurisdiction_company_number: Company number of the home company if the entity is a branch
        industry_code_uids: List of SIC codes (Standard Industrial Classifications)

    staged_entity_additional - Additional data specific to staged entities (manually entered with staged_entities)
        contact_info:
        source_meta:
        source_raw:

extended_data.title: Extended Data
extended_data.description: Optional user-provided data associated to associate with the entity. This data is private and never used or shared across organizations.

auto_research.title: Research Entity
auto_research.description: If 'true', the data provided on this Entity may be used by Mesur systems to improve the quality and quantity of information associated with the Entity.

monitor.title: Monitor Entity
monitor.description: If 'true', system events impacting this Entity or any Entity in its supply chain (as defined by the parameters set in Entity.subscription) will generate Notifications. Notifications can be viewed and acknowledged at /notifications endpoints.

callback_url.title: Callback Url
callback_url.description: If this entity is being monitored and a callback_url is provided, the callback URL will be periodically called if there are unacknowledged Notifications for this Entity.

data_score.title: Data Score

If 'filter_strategy' is 'lax', every edge on any path between a matched HS code and the entrypoint is included, as well as every edge that lies between a matched HS code and the entrypoint Entity. If no HS codes are provided, this parameter has no effect.

Flag.title: Flag
Flag.description:
Represents a flag associated with a particular entity.

A flag is positive if, for example, the entity it is associated with has
been certified by an authoritative body to be in compliance with an accepted
standard. It is negative if the associated entity participates in or is
associated with a sanctioned, illegal, or otherwise undesirable activity.

Attributes:
    id: Database id of the record, corresponds to mongodb '_id'.

    entity_id: Database id of the entity the flag is applied to, corresponds
    to target entity '_id' in mongodb.

    schema_version: Document schema.

    type: Details about the nature of the flag. This may be the name of the
    relevant certification or sanction, e.g. 'RSPO Certified' or 'ITAR
    Debarred (DTC) - State Department', or a more general category, e.g.
    'forced labor'. This should be an ObjectIdField stored in the 'flag_types'
    collection - optionally a string allowed here for validation when the ObjectId
    field needs to be looked up and displayed in the portal.

    tags: A list of semi-arbitrary strings that provides additional
    classifications or detail on the nature of the flag type. An example of
    this might be a flag with type "Forced Labor Risk" with subtype
    "Operating in Uyghur Region", "Sourcing directly from Uyghur Region", or
    "Accepted labor transfers outside Uyghur Region".

    source: List of ONE url to a page containing information that is
    relevant to the flag, or the entity it applies to. For user-uploaded
    flags, this field will be None.

    entity_jurisdiction: ISO country code of the entity that the flag
    applies to, if the jurisdiction is known.

    customer_managed: This field is true if a customer has created this flag
    directly, otherwise, it is false. A customer-managed flag MUST NOT be
    visible outside of the organization of the user who created it.

    owner_email: The email address of the user who created the
    customer-managed flag. If 'customer_managed' is false, this field MUST
    be None.

    organization: The globally-unique name of the organization to which a
    customer-managed flag belongs, which is currently the same as the
    organization to which the flag's creator belongs. If 'customer_managed'
    if false, this field MUST be None.

    is_positive: A derived field not present on the underlying record. This
    field controls whether the flag is displayed to users as a 'positive' or
    'negative' flag.

    deleted: Whether or not the flag is currently in-force.

    deleted_at: If the flag is no longer in force for any reason, this field
    is the time the flag ceased to be applicable to the target entity.

    deletion_source: If 'deleted_at' is not null, this field explains why
    the flag is no longer in effect. It may be a URL to a web source
    offering further explanation.

    confidence: For flag records generated by bots, this field indicates the
    strength of our belief that the decision to assign a flag is correct.
    100 is the most confident, 0 is the least. If a flag was not generated
    by a bot, this field must be None.

    time_start: Time at which flag took effect. Currently, this field is
    only set on Flags uploaded via Earthstream API.

    time_end: Time after which flag is no longer in effect. Currently, this
    field is only set on Flags uploaded via Earthstream API.

    description: Plain-text description for the flag. Currently, this field
    is only set on Flags uploaded via Earthstream API.

    # TODO: TV-10497 Remove this field, as the default is set to 0.5, which is being nullified
    # in GraphEntity.entity_score. This might be important for risk events, but not for Flags.
    score: The score of the flag.

    decay_factor: The amount by which a flag decays, which is re-calculated daily according to
    the flag's decay strategy and the flag's age. This gets factored into an entity's score
    through the TradeverifydScoringService later on, through the regulatory flag strategy. The
    decay_factor should always be a float between 0 and 1, but for soft deleted flags, it will
    be set to 1.0 as to not impact the entity's score.

    decay_version: The version of the decay strategy used to calculate the decay_factor.

    penalties: A optional list of dictionaries, each containing the following keys:
    - penalty_agency: The agency that issued the penalty
    - penalty_usd: The amount of the penalty in USD
    - penalty_date: The date of the penalty

FlagDTO.title: FlagDTO
FlagDTO.description:
Represents a flag in the context of the application, serving as a marker
for significant information, warnings, or alerts.

Attributes:

    timestamp: Timestamp indicating when the flag was created or recorded.
    time_start: The beginning time when the flag becomes relevant or
                active.
    time_end: The ending time after which the flag is no longer considered
              relevant.
    name: Optional field for naming the flag, providing additional
          context. Max length 512 characters.
    description: Optional field for describing the flag's purpose and
                 significance. Max length 4096 characters.
    sources: Optional list of sources or references that provide
             information or evidence related to the flag.
    status: Optional object with state, confidence and source information
            for the status of the flag. Status may be suspected, confirmed,
            or invalid.

Note:
    Flags are used to draw attention to specific conditions or situations,
    and they can be dynamically updated based on new information or
    changing circumstances.

                  product. Defaults to None.

                   product, allowing flexibility to include various
                   extended attributes.

Note:

status.title: Status
status.description:
Whether or not this entity's GLEIF registration is expired.

A value of 'current' means 'This entity's GLEIF registration status is known, and
it was not expired at the time the entity was retrieved from Mesur database.

A value of 'expired' means 'This entity's GLEIF registration status is known, and
it was expired at the time the entity was retrieved from Mesur database.

A value of 'unknown' means 'There may or may not be other GLEIF registration data
available on this record, but it does not include an expiration date, so no
determination about the currency of that registration was possible at the time the
entity was retrieved from Mesur database'.

Registration.title: Registration
Registration.description:
Registration information for an entity

Datetime fields are parsed using dateutil.parser.parse
(https://dateutil.readthedocs.io/en/stable/parser.html).
Temporal resolution of input data varies, so resulting datetime
objects may have 'time' fields zeroed-out. For example,
dateutil.parser.parse("2023-1-1") returns
datetime.datetime(2023,1,1,0,0). Resulting datetime will be naive
unless input string specifies an offset ("+=") or is explicitly
in universal time ("Z", "UTC").
Currently, the underlying data on date, updated, and expires fields
are mixed type fields, either str or datetime.

mesur_data_access__tradeverifyd__datamod.title: Address
mesur_data_access__tradeverifyd__datamod.description:
Address object that matches Earthstream API format. Eventually, all existing
address information will migrate to this field.

Attributes:
    address_id: Unique identifier for this address instance.

    type: Defines the kind of location Address represents, if it is known.
    If unspecified, value will be 'general'.

    language: two to four letter string comprising the ISO language code in
    which the address lines are written

    lines: One or more strings representing a plain-text address. Roll
    LocationInformation fields addressNumber, addressNumberWithinBuilding,
    and mailRouting into this string.

    city: one string representing a plain-text city name.

    region: one string representing a plain-text region name.

    country: one string representing a plain-text country name.

    postal_code: one string representing a plain-text address postal code.

    coordinates: object of GeoJSONPoint class representing latitude and
    longitude

    is_default: boolean allowing tracking of which Address is providing
    top-level 'jurisdiction' info. That way if there are multiple different
    addresses for an Entity, the default address can easily be retrieved

tags.name: Entity
tags.description: Operations involving entities. Entities encompass a range of organizations and individuals, primarily focusing on companies. This section provides functionalities to manage and interact with information about various entities, including their details, activities, and roles in the supply chain.

tags.name: Risk Events
tags.description: Manage and retrieve events related to entities. This includes real-time updates on critical incidents like supply chain disruptions, compliance issues, or significant changes affecting entities. Stay informed about vital events that could impact your business operations and decision-making processes.

tags.name: Reports
tags.description: Access detailed Tradeverifyd reports. These comprehensive reports offer an in-depth analysis of suppliers, complete with compliance scoring to highlight potential trade-related issues. Utilize these reports for thorough assessments of supplier reliability, compliance status, and overall performance in the supply chain.
